creator: willi.firulais@lycos.com
text:
PDF/X-3:2002 should go with PDF Version 1.3

Wouldn't it be cool if you can print a real book with Apache FOP?

Apache FOP is a great tool for creating pdf documents from xml.
Thx for all your effort you put into the development of this tool.

To be able to print the pdf to a real book with http://www.blurb.com/make/pdf_to_book
we need a PDF/X-3:2002 in PDF Version 1.3, because PDF Version 1.4 is not accepted.

Q: Is there a possibility to produce a PDF "1.3" Version for PDF/X-3:2002 with some setting?

Currently i try to generate a pdf for printing at blurb (http://www.blurb.com/make/pdf_to_book).
When uploading the generated pdf to blub i get the follwing message:
	
"The PDF you selected is not in PDF/X-3:2002 format or PDF 1.3 compatible. You should use the PDF/X-3:2002 format set with Acrobat 4 (PDF 1.3) compatibility for correct printing with Blurbs network. Please revise your PDF and try again."

The pdf is not accepted because it is the Version 1.4.
I've also checked the PDF with the Preflight of "Adobe Acrobat X",
witch also is complaining that the PDF/X-3:2002 should go with Version 1.3.
Preflight Summary-Report: "Error: PDF-Version is newer than 1.3."

Q: I've seen on the enhancement list that it is planned to have a parameter in FOP
(config, or so) to change the Version. Is there some idea when this may be?

Thx a lot in advance,
  Willi

Will Version 1.3 be supported?

"This allows PDF versions to be specified between 1.4-1.7."
https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=51385
creator: willi.firulais@lycos.com
med1985@gmail.com
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> Will Version 1.3 be supported?
> 
> "This allows PDF versions to be specified between 1.4-1.7."
> https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=51385

The situation is a little more nuanced than that. There maybe something I'm missing, but as far as I know the simplest answer is no, it's not possible to create a PDF whose version is < 1.3. Why? Because FOP hasn't been designed to be able to control the PDF version of the output. As such, there is too much that is hard-coded to be able to produce PDF versions < 1.4 without a significant effort in development.

However, producing pdfs > 1.4 is easy, simply because they're all backwards compatible. As such, all PDF versions 1.4 are also valid as PDF 1.5, 1.6 and 1.7. So in order to create greater PDF versions all I had to do was change a version header.

Hope that helps

creator: willi.firulais@lycos.com
text:
Thx a lot for your clear answer.

Without the Version 1.3 it will never be PDF/X-3:2002 complient (according to Acrobat Preflight) and therefore not suitable for usage in a professional printing process ;-(

regards, Willi

creator: jeremias@apache.org
text: Why so negative? FOP does support PDF/X-3:2003 (based on PDF 1.4) to a certain degree. A successor to the spec you're after. There are lots of others PDF/X specs by now. It has even become a forest of choices. It's difficult to support them all. Since FOP is open source you could even help us retrofit PDF 1.3 but given PDF 1.3's age, that doesn't really make sense.
